legal_basis: Sections 7 and 15 of the Charter of Rights and Freedoms
charter_rights: Section 7 - life, liberty, and security of the person
decision_reasoning: certification process aligns with fundamental justice
distinctions between citizens and noncitizens are justified
application_details: Section 83 limits appeals to cases where a serious question of general importance is certified
procedure_followed: Judicial review and analysis of Section 83's compliance with Sections 7 and 15 of the Charter
result_of_case: court rejected the applicant's arguments, upholding Section 83 as constitutional
